pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:0.5_0: The training rule on lying down
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.16_0: if he asks those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.17_0: if it is by means of one’s own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.18_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.21_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood with large amounts of bean curry. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.5_0: there are two kinds of bean curry:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.7_0: he should eat the almsfood with the right proportion of bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk34:1.8_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
